meanings.definition: To repeat or imitate without understanding or thought.
meanings.sent1: She was just parroting what the teacher said without really knowing what it meant.
meanings.sent2: The child was parroting the song lyrics he heard on the radio.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was parroting the owner's sneeze, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: Her little brother was parroting her every move, like a mirror reflecting her actions.
meanings.sent5: The robot was parroting the commands it was programmed to follow, showing no originality.

meanings.definition: To mimic or copy someone else's words or actions.
meanings.sent1: He was parroting his friend's jokes to make others laugh.
meanings.sent2: The comedian was known for parroting famous politicians in his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was parroting the dog's bark, causing confusion in the household.
meanings.sent4: The student was parroting the professor's lecture, hoping to impress with knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The actor was parroting the gestures of the character he was portraying, down to the smallest detail.

meanings.definition: The act of mindlessly repeating something said by another.
meanings.sent1: Her constant parroting of her favorite catchphrase annoyed her friends.
meanings.sent2: The politician's parroting of the same promises lost its impact over time.
meanings.sent3: The parrot's parroting of the TV commercials made the family laugh every time.
meanings.sent4: The parroting of the old legend by the villagers added a sense of tradition to the storytelling.
meanings.sent5: The child's parroting of the nursery rhyme was so adorable that everyone joined in singing along.
